decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with early disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Hymn to Tourach, while applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Tombstalker. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push, while also generating card advantage with cards like Sylvan Library and Liliana, the Last Hope. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and utilizes cards like Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman for additional utility.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible by using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to search for the necessary pieces. It also includes disruptive elements like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo from disruption. Pithing Needle is included as a versatile answer to various threats, while Sylvan Safekeeper helps protect key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token as its win condition while controlling the game through disruption and efficient searching.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful control cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Terminus, Counterspell, Force of Will, and Counterbalance. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources through cards like Monastery Mentor and Search for Azcanta. By utilizing card draw and manipulation effects like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Portent, the deck can set up powerful plays and keep the opponent on the back foot. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast and outsmart the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes various counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and disruption cards like Flusterstorm to support the combo. It plays efficient card draw and selection cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key combo pieces. The deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and overpower the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through efficient removal, counter spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent with aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis while also generating value through cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Liliana, the Last Hope. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a stable board presence.

This Legacy Aggro-Burn deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using a combination of low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel. The deck also includes key cards like Price of Progress and Sulfuric Vortex to punish opponents for playing non-basic lands and potentially lock them out of the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient damage before they can stabilize or gain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures and equipment. By utilizing disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays while setting up its own threats with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard. This Aggro - Death & Taxes archetype leverages its disruptive elements and efficient creatures to grind out opponents and generate value from cards like Aether Vial and Karakas.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources by utilizing lands to disrupt their game plan. It aims to lock down the board with cards like Ghost Quarter and Wasteland, while also utilizing cards like Life from the Loam and Crucible of Worlds to repeatedly recur valuable lands. The deck also has a combo finish with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 creature. With a mix of land destruction, recursion, and a potent win condition, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy game.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Lion's Eye Diamond in order to cast powerful spells like Ad Nauseum and Tendrils of Agony to secure a win through storm count. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Gitaxian Probe to find key combo pieces. Cabal Therapy and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan while Past in Flames allows for recursion of spells from the graveyard. This deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a high storm count.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana and cards through spells like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond, while controlling the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy. The goal is to set up a powerful combo turn using Infernal Tutor to search for key pieces like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam, ultimately leading to a lethal storm count to win the game. The deck utilizes efficient cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to filter through the deck and dig for combo pieces.

The main strategy of this deck is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Deathrite Shaman, while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats, as well as card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the goal is to maintain a tempo advantage and close out the game quickly.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents with hand disruption and removal spells while establishing a solid board presence with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to control the game and generate incremental advantage. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull helps to further solidify the deck's board presence and provide additional ways to win the game. Overall, the deck focuses on control elements to outvalue and outlast opponents in the long game.

The main idea of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Maverick deck is to aggressively control the board with disruptive creatures and removal spells while also efficiently tutoring for key threats or answers with Green Sun's Zenith. The deck utilizes a variety of powerful creatures like Mother of Runes, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Knight of the Reliquary, along with equipment such as Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Loam can provide additional utility and flexibility in different matchups.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through removal spells like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, backed up by powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell. The deck also focuses on card advantage and selection, utilizing cards like Snapcaster Mage, Ponder, and Brainstorm. With cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, ultimately winning the game with finishers like Entreat the Angels. The inclusion of Counterbalance and Predict adds further control elements to the deck.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to find Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It also includes ways to protect the combo piece, such as Sylvan Safekeeper and Pithing Needle, as well as disruptive cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. The deck can generate mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide, enabling a fast win condition by creating a 20/20 Marit Lage token with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in just one turn. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with hand disruption spells like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Inquisition of Kozilek while protecting its combo pieces with cards like Pithing Needle and Sylvan Safekeeper. With the ability to search for key lands with cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Into the North, this deck can efficiently set up its win condition and overpower opponents with a powerful, game-ending threat.
